alert.note: Alert for Bath; Estill; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:14AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Powell, Montgomery, Bath, northern Estill, western Menifee, southeastern Fleming and west central Rowan Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 614 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winchester to near Richmond. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Grassy Lick, Sideview, Wades Mill, Prewitt and Klondike around 625 AM EDT. Mount Sterling, Judy, Palmer, Stoops, Cressy, Iron Mound, Ewington, Fox, Hargett and Gatewoods Station around 630 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Flat Creek, Spout Springs, Kimbrell, Stepstone, Howards Mill, Peeled Oak, Hardwick, Owingsville, Clay City, Virden, Waltersville, Powell Valley, Westbend, Reynoldsville, Bourbon Furnace, Kendall Springs, Vaughns Mill, Stanton, Marshall, Camargo, Slate Valley, Craigs, Wyoming, Peasticks, Bean, Polksville, Cat Creek, Jeffersonville, Salt Lick, Means, Cedar Groves, Lucky Stop, Clay Lick, Moore`s Ferry, Walkers Crossing, Oggs Station, Midland, Cornwell, Sharkey, Rothwell, Fagan, Tabor, Ramey, Hope, Frenchburg, Sudith, Olympia Springs and Young Springs. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 12 and 32. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 133. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Estill; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell; Rowan
